   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% This test suite is basically a "placeholder" for a proper test suite...
   23: %% Also we should really call prim_net directly, and not net (since that does
   24: %% not even reside here).
   25: %%
   26: 
   27: %% Starting a VM to run tests with ct:
   28: %% ( cd $LOCAL_TESTS/27/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/erl -sname kernel-27-tester -pa $LOCAL_TESTS/27/test_server )
   29: %%
   30: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   31: %% ts:run(emulator, net_SUITE, [batch]).
   32: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end, S(net_SUITE).
   33: %%
   34: %% Run a specific group:
   35: %% ts:run(emulator, net_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   36: %%
   37: %% Run a specific test case:
   38: %% ts:run(emulator, net_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   39: 
   40: -module(net_SUITE).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   43: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   44: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   45: 
   46: %% Suite exports
   47: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   48: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   49:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   50:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   51: 
   52: %% Test cases
   53: -export([
   54:          %% *** API Basic ***
   55:          api_b_gethostname/1,
   56:          api_b_getifaddrs/1,
   57:          api_b_getservbyname/1,
   58:          api_b_getservbyport/1,
   59:          api_b_name_and_addr_info/1,
   60:          api_b_name_and_index/1,
   61: 
   62:          %% *** API Misc ***
   63:          api_m_getaddrinfo_v4/0,
   64:          api_m_getaddrinfo_v4/1,
   65:          api_m_getaddrinfo_v6/0,
   66:          api_m_getaddrinfo_v6/1,
   67: 
   68:          api_m_getnameinfo_v4/0,
   69:          api_m_getnameinfo_v4/1,
   70:          api_m_getnameinfo_v6/0,
   71:          api_m_getnameinfo_v6/1,
   72: 
   73:          api_m_getservbyname_overflow/1
   74: 
   75:          %% Tickets
   76:         ]).
   77: 
   78: 
   79: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
   80: 
   81: -define(FAIL(R), exit(R)).
   82: -define(SKIP(R), throw({skip, R})).
   83: 
   84: 
   85: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
   86: 
   87: suite() ->
   88:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   89:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   90: 
   91: all() -> 
   92:     Groups = [{api, "ENET_TEST_API", include}],
   93:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
   94: 
   95: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
   96: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
   97: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
   98: 		[{group, Group}];
   99: 	    false ->
  100: 		[];
  101: 	    Val ->
  102: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  103: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  104: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  105: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  106: 			[{group, Group}];
  107: 		    _ ->
  108: 			[]
  109: 		end
  110: 	end.
  111:     
  112: 
  113: groups() -> 
  114:     [{api,       [], api_cases()},
  115:      {api_basic, [], api_basic_cases()},
  116:      {api_misc,  [], api_misc_cases()}
  117: 
  118:      %% {tickets, [], ticket_cases()}
  119:     ].
  120:      
  121: api_cases() ->
  122:     [
  123:      {group, api_basic},
  124:      {group, api_misc}
  125:     ].
  126: 
  127: api_basic_cases() ->
  128:     [
  129:      api_b_gethostname,
  130:      api_b_getifaddrs,
  131:      api_b_getservbyname,
  132:      api_b_getservbyport,
  133:      api_b_name_and_addr_info,
  134:      api_b_name_and_index
  135:     ].
  136: 
  137: api_misc_cases() ->
  138:     [
  139:      api_m_getaddrinfo_v4,
  140:      api_m_getaddrinfo_v6,
  141:      api_m_getnameinfo_v4,
  142:      api_m_getnameinfo_v6,
  143:      api_m_getservbyname_overflow
  144:     ].
  145: 
  146: %% ticket_cases() ->
  147: %%     [].
  148: 
  149: 
  150: 
  151: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  152: 
  153: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  154: 
  155:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  156:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  157:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  158: 
  159:     try net:info() of
  160:         #{} ->
  161: 
  162:             case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  163:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  164:                     SKIP;
  165: 
  166:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  167: 
  168:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  169:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  170: 
  171:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
  172:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  173: 
  174:                     Config1
  175:             end
  176: 
  177:     catch
  178:         error : notsup ->
  179:             {skip, "net not supported"}
  180:     end.
  181: 
  182: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  183: 
  184:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  185:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  186:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  187: 
  188:     %% Stop the local monitor
  189:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  190: 
  191:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  192: 
  193:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  194:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  195: 
  196:     Config1.
  197: 
  198: init_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
  199:     Config.
  200: 
  201: end_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
  202:     Config.
  203: 
  204: 
  205: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  206:     Config.
  207: 
  208: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  209:     Config.
  210: 
  211: 
  212: 
  213: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  214: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  215: %%                                                                     %%
  216: %%                           API BASIC                                 %%
  217: %%                                                                     %%
  218: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  219: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  220: 
  221: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  222: 
  223: %% Get the hostname of the host.
  224: api_b_gethostname(suite) ->
  225:     [];
  226: api_b_gethostname(doc) ->
  227:     [];
  228: api_b_gethostname(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  229:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
  230:     tc_try(api_b_gethostname,
  231:            fun() ->
  232:                    ok = api_b_gethostname()
  233:            end).
  234: 
  235: 
  236: api_b_gethostname() ->
  237:     case net:gethostname() of
  238:         {ok, Hostname} ->
  239:             i("hostname: ~s", [Hostname]),
  240:             ok;
  241:         {error, enotsup = Reason} ->
  242:             i("gethostname not supported - skipping"),
  243:             skip(Reason);
  244:         {error, Reason} ->
  245:             ?FAIL(Reason)
  246:     end.
  247: 
  248: 
  249: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  250: 
  251: %% This is a *very* basic test. It simply calls the function and expect
  252: %% it to succeed...
  253: api_b_getifaddrs(suite) ->
  254:     [];
  255: api_b_getifaddrs(doc) ->
  256:     [];
  257: api_b_getifaddrs(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  258:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
  259:     tc_try(api_b_getifaddrs,
  260:            fun() ->
  261:                    ok = api_b_getifaddrs()
  262:            end).
  263: 
  264: 
  265: api_b_getifaddrs() ->
  266:     try net:getifaddrs() of
  267:         {ok, IfAddrs} ->
  268:             i("IfAddrs: "
  269:               "~n   ~p", [IfAddrs]),
  270:             verify_broadcast(IfAddrs),
  271:             verify_loopback(IfAddrs),
  272:             ok;
  273:         {error, enotsup = Reason} ->
  274:             i("getifaddrs not supported - skipping"),
  275:             skip(Reason);
  276:         {error, Reason} ->
  277:             ?FAIL(Reason)
  278:     catch
  279:         error : notsup = CReason ->
  280:             Fun     = fun(F) when is_function(F, 0) ->
  281:                               try F()
  282:                               catch C:E:S -> {catched, {C, E, S}}
  283:                               end
  284:                       end,
  285:             Res2Str = fun({ok, Res})         -> ?F("ok: ~p", [Res]);
  286:                          ({error, Reason})   -> ?F("error: ~p", [Reason]);
  287:                          ({catched, {C, E}}) -> ?F("catched: ~w, ~p", [C, E])
  288:                       end,
  289:             IIRes    = Fun(fun() -> prim_net:get_interface_info(#{}) end),
  290:             ATRes    = Fun(fun() -> prim_net:get_ip_address_table(#{}) end),
  291:             AARes    = Fun(fun() -> prim_net:get_adapters_addresses(#{}) end),
  292:             IIResStr = Res2Str(IIRes),
  293:             ATResStr = Res2Str(ATRes),
  294:             IFERes   = win_getifaddrs_ife(IIRes, ATRes),
  295:             AAResStr = Res2Str(AARes),
  296:             %% Note that the prim_net module is *not* intended to 
  297:             %% be called directly. This is just a temporary thing.
  298:             i("~w => skipping"
  299:               "~n   Interface Info: "
  300:               "~n      ~s"
  301:               "~n   IP Address Table: "
  302:               "~n      ~s"
  303:               "~n   MIB If Table: "
  304:               "~n      ~p"
  305:               "~n   Adapters Addresses: "
  306:               "~n      ~p",
  307:               [CReason, IIResStr, ATResStr, IFERes, AAResStr]),
  308:             skip(CReason)
  309:     end.
  310: 
  311: 
  312: verify_broadcast([]) ->
  313:     ok;
  314: verify_broadcast([#{flags     := Flags,
  315:                     broadaddr := _} = IfAddr|IfAddrs]) ->
  316:     %% Must have the 'broadcast' flag
  317:     case lists:member(broadcast, Flags) of
  318:         true ->
  319:             verify_broadcast(IfAddrs);
  320:         false ->
  321:             ?FAIL({missing_broadcast_flag, IfAddr})
  322:     end;
  323: verify_broadcast([_|IfAddrs]) ->
  324:     verify_broadcast(IfAddrs).
  325: 
  326: verify_loopback([]) ->
  327:     ok;
  328: verify_loopback([#{name  := "lo",
  329:                    flags := Flags,
  330:                    addr  := _Addr} = IfAddr|IfAddrs]) ->
  331:     %% Must have the 'broadcast' flag
  332:     case lists:member(loopback, Flags) of
  333:         true ->
  334:             verify_loopback(IfAddrs);
  335:         false ->
  336:             ?FAIL({missing_loopback_flag, IfAddr})
  337:     end;
  338: verify_loopback([_|IfAddrs]) ->
  339:     verify_loopback(IfAddrs).
  340: 
  341: 
  342: win_getifaddrs_ife({ok, II}, {ok, AT}) ->
  343:     IDX1 = [IDX || #{index := IDX} <- II],
  344:     IDX2 = [IDX || #{index := IDX} <- AT],
  345:     MergedIDX = merge(IDX1, IDX2),
  346:     MibIfTable =
  347:         [try prim_net:get_if_entry(#{index => IDX}) of
  348:              {ok, Entry} ->
  349:                  Entry;
  350:              {error, _} = ERROR ->
  351:                  {IDX, ERROR}
  352:          catch
  353:              %% This is *very* unlikely since we got here because of
  354:              %% a previous 'notsup'. But just in case...
  355:              error : notsup = CReason ->
  356:                  {IDX, CReason};
  357:              C:E ->
  358:                  {IDX, {C, E}}
  359:          end || IDX <- MergedIDX],
  360:     MibIfTable;
  361: win_getifaddrs_ife(_, _) ->
  362:     undefined.
  363: 
  364:     
  365: merge([], L) ->
  366:     lists:sort(L);
  367: merge([H|T], L) ->
  368:     case lists:member(H, L) of
  369:         true ->
  370:             merge(T, L);
  371:         false ->
  372:             merge(T, [H|L])
  373:     end.
  374: 
  375:             
  376: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  377: 
  378: %% This is a *very* basic test. It simply calls the function with 
  379: %% a a couple of diifferent arguments...
  380: api_b_getservbyname(suite) ->
  381:     [];
  382: api_b_getservbyname(doc) ->
  383:     [];
  384: api_b_getservbyname(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  385:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
  386:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  387:            fun() ->
  388:                    ok = api_b_getservbyname()
  389:            end).
  390: 
  391: 
  392: api_b_getservbyname() ->
  393:     ?P("A couple of (expected) successes"),
  394:     {ok, 80}   = net:getservbyname("http"),
  395:     {ok, 80}   = net:getservbyname("http", any),
  396:     {ok, 80}   = net:getservbyname("http", tcp),
  397:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  398:                            case net:getservbyname("www", udp) of
  399:                                {ok, 80} ->
  400:                                    ok;
  401:                                {ok, WrongPort} ->
  402:                                    wrong_port("www", tcp, WrongPort, 80);
  403:                                {error, Reason} ->
  404:                                    case os:type() of
  405:                                        {unix, linux}
  406:                                          when (Reason =:= einval) ->
  407:                                            %% This happens on some linux
  408:                                            %% (Ubuntu 22 on Parallels ARM VM)
  409:                                            ok;
  410:                                        _ ->
  411:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  412:                                               [Reason]),
  413:                                            ?FAIL({"www", udp, Reason})
  414:                                    end
  415:                            end
  416:                    end),
  417:     {ok, 161}  = net:getservbyname("snmp", udp),
  418:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  419:                            case net:getservbyname("snmp", tcp) of
  420:                                {ok, 161} ->
  421:                                    ok;
  422:                                {ok, WrongPort} ->
  423:                                    wrong_port("snmp", tcp, WrongPort, 161);
  424:                                {error, Reason} ->
  425:                                    case os:type() of
  426:                                        {unix, Flavor}
  427:                                          when ((Flavor =:= openbsd) orelse
  428:                                                (Flavor =:= solaris) orelse
  429:                                                (Flavor =:= sunos)) andalso
  430:                                               (Reason =:= einval) ->
  431:                                            ok;
  432:                                        _ ->
  433:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  434:                                               [Reason]),
  435:                                            ?FAIL({"snmp", tcp, Reason})
  436:                                    end
  437:                            end
  438:                    end),
  439:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  440:                            case net:getservbyname("epmd", tcp) of
  441:                                {ok, 4369} ->
  442:                                    ok;
  443:                                {ok, WrongPort} ->
  444:                                    wrong_port("epmd", tcp, WrongPort, 4369);
  445:                                {error, Reason} ->
  446:                                    case os:type() of
  447:                                        {unix, openbsd} 
  448:                                          when (Reason =:= einval) ->
  449:                                            ok;
  450:                                        _ ->
  451:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  452:                                               [Reason]),
  453:                                            ?FAIL({"epmd", tcp, Reason})
  454:                                    end
  455:                            end
  456:                    end),
  457:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  458:                            case net:getservbyname("amqp", tcp) of
  459:                                {ok, 5672} ->
  460:                                    ok;
  461:                                {ok, WrongPort} ->
  462:                                    wrong_port("amqp", tcp, WrongPort, 5672);
  463:                                {error, Reason} ->
  464:                                    case os:type() of
  465:                                        {unix, openbsd} 
  466:                                          when (Reason =:= einval) ->
  467:                                            ok;
  468:                                        _ ->
  469:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  470:                                               [Reason]),
  471:                                            ?FAIL({"amqp", tcp, Reason})
  472:                                    end
  473:                            end
  474:                    end),
  475:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  476:                            case net:getservbyname("amqp", sctp) of
  477:                                {ok, 5672} ->
  478:                                    ok;
  479:                                {ok, WrongPort} ->
  480:                                    wrong_port("amqp", sctp, WrongPort, 5672);
  481:                                {error, Reason} ->
  482:                                    case os:type() of
  483:                                        {unix, darwin}
  484:                                          when (Reason =:= einval) ->
  485:                                            ok;
  486:                                        {unix, openbsd}
  487:                                          when (Reason =:= einval) ->
  488:                                            ok;
  489:                                        _ ->
  490:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  491:                                               [Reason]),
  492:                                            ?FAIL({"amqp", sctp, Reason})
  493:                                    end
  494:                            end
  495:                    end),
  496: 
  497:     ?P("A couple of (expected) failures"),
  498:     {error, einval} = net:getservbyname("gurka", tcp),
  499:     case net:getservbyname("http", gurka) of
  500:         {error, einval} ->
  501:             ok;
  502:         {ok, 80} ->
  503:             case os:type() of
  504:                 {unix, darwin} ->
  505:                     %% Darwin seems to ignore the clearly invalid protocol
  506:                     %% and just looks at the Service...
  507:                     ok;
  508:                 _ ->
  509:                     ?P("Unexpected success"),
  510:                     ?FAIL({"http", gurka})
  511:             end
  512:     end,
  513: 
  514:     ?P("done"),
  515:     ok.
  516: 
  517: 
  518: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  519: 
  520: %% This is a *very* basic test. It simply calls the function and expect
  521: %% it to succeed...
  522: api_b_getservbyport(suite) ->
  523:     [];
  524: api_b_getservbyport(doc) ->
  525:     [];
  526: api_b_getservbyport(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  527:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
  528:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  529:            fun() ->
  530:                    ok = api_b_getservbyport()
  531:            end).
  532: 
  533: 
  534: api_b_getservbyport() ->
  535:     ?P("A couple of (expected) successes"),
  536:     case net:getservbyport(80) of
  537:         {ok, "http"} ->
  538:             ok;
  539:         {ok, "www"} ->
  540:             ok;
  541:         {ok, OtherSrv1} ->
  542:             wrong_service(80, default, OtherSrv1, ["http", "www"]);
  543:         {error, Reason1} ->
  544:             ?FAIL({unexpected_failure, 80, default, Reason1})
  545:     end,
  546:     case net:getservbyport(80, any) of
  547:         {ok, "http"} ->
  548:             ok;
  549:         {ok, "www"} ->
  550:             ok;
  551:         {ok, OtherSrv2} ->
  552:             wrong_service(80, any, OtherSrv2, ["http", "www"]);
  553:         {error, Reason2} ->
  554:             ?FAIL({unexpected_failure, 80, any, Reason2})
  555:     end,
  556:     case net:getservbyport(80, tcp) of
  557:         {ok, "http"} ->
  558:             ok;
  559:         {ok, "www"} ->
  560:             ok;
  561:         {ok, OtherSrv3} ->
  562:             wrong_service(80, tcp, OtherSrv3, ["http", "www"]);
  563:         {error, Reason3} ->
  564:             ?FAIL({unexpected_failure, 80, tcp, Reason3})
  565:     end,
  566:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  567:                            case net:getservbyport(80,   udp) of
  568:                                {ok, STR} when (STR =:= "http") orelse
  569:                                               (STR =:= "www") orelse
  570:                                               (STR =:= "WWW") -> ok;
  571:                                {ok, WrongService} ->
  572:                                    wrong_service(80, udp,
  573:                                                  WrongService,
  574:                                                  ["http", "www"]);
  575:                                {error, Reason4} ->
  576:                                    case os:type() of
  577:                                        {unix, linux}
  578:                                          when (Reason4 =:= einval) ->
  579:                                            %% This happens on some linux
  580:                                            %% (Ubuntu 22 on Parallels ARM VM)
  581:                                            ok;
  582:                                        _ ->
  583:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  584:                                               [Reason4]),
  585:                                            ?FAIL({80, udp, Reason4})
  586:                                    end
  587:                            end
  588:                    end),
  589:     case net:getservbyport(161,  udp) of
  590:         {ok, "snmp"} ->
  591:             ok;
  592:         {ok, "snmpd"} -> %% Solaris/Sunos
  593:             ok
  594:     end,
  595:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  596:                            case net:getservbyport(161, tcp) of
  597:                                {ok, "snmp"} ->
  598:                                    ok;
  599:                                {ok, WrongService} ->
  600:                                    wrong_service(161, tcp,
  601:                                                  WrongService, "snmp");
  602:                                {error, Reason} ->
  603:                                    case os:type() of
  604:                                        {unix, Flavor}
  605:                                          when ((Flavor =:= openbsd) orelse
  606:                                                (Flavor =:= solaris) orelse
  607:                                                (Flavor =:= sunos)) andalso
  608:                                               (Reason =:= einval) ->
  609:                                            ok;
  610:                                        _ ->
  611:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  612:                                               [Reason]),
  613:                                            ?FAIL({161, tcp, Reason})
  614:                                    end
  615:                            end
  616:                    end),
  617:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  618:                            case net:getservbyport(4369, tcp) of
  619:                                {ok, "epmd"} ->
  620:                                    ok;
  621:                                {ok, WrongService} ->
  622:                                    wrong_service(4369, tcp,
  623:                                                  WrongService, "epmd");
  624:                                {error, Reason} ->
  625:                                    case os:type() of
  626:                                        {unix, openbsd} 
  627:                                          when (Reason =:= einval) ->
  628:                                            ok;
  629:                                        _ ->
  630:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  631:                                               [Reason]),
  632:                                            ?FAIL({4369, tcp, Reason})
  633:                                    end
  634:                            end
  635:                    end),
  636:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  637:                            case net:getservbyport(5672, tcp) of
  638:                                {ok, "amqp"} ->
  639:                                    ok;
  640:                                {ok, WrongService} ->
  641:                                    wrong_service(5672, tcp,
  642:                                                  WrongService, "amqp");
  643:                                {error, Reason} ->
  644:                                    case os:type() of
  645:                                        {unix, openbsd} 
  646:                                          when (Reason =:= einval) ->
  647:                                            ok;
  648:                                        _ ->
  649:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  650:                                               [Reason]),
  651:                                            ?FAIL({5672, tcp, Reason})
  652:                                    end
  653:                            end
  654:                    end),
  655:     not_on_windows(fun() ->
  656:                            case net:getservbyport(5672, sctp) of
  657:                                {ok, "amqp"} ->
  658:                                    ok;
  659:                                {ok, WrongService} ->
  660:                                    wrong_service(5672, sctp,
  661:                                                  WrongService, "amqp");
  662:                                {error, Reason} when (Reason =:= einval) ->
  663:                                    case os:type() of
  664:                                        {unix, UNIX}
  665:                                          when (UNIX =:= darwin) orelse
  666:                                               (UNIX =:= openbsd) ->
  667:                                            ok;
  668:                                        _ ->
  669:                                            ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  670:                                               [Reason]),
  671:                                            ?FAIL({"amqp", sctp, Reason})
  672:                                    end;
  673:                                {error, Reason} ->
  674:                                    ?P("Unexpected failure: ~p",
  675:                                       [Reason]),
  676:                                    ?FAIL({"amqp", sctp, Reason})
  677:                            end
  678:                    end),
  679: 
  680:     ?P("A couple of (expected) failures"),
  681:     {error, einval} = net:getservbyport(16#FFFF, tcp),
  682:     {error, einval} = net:getservbyport(80,      gurka),
  683: 
  684:     ?P("done"),
  685:     ok.
  686: 
  687: 
  688: not_on_windows(F) ->
  689:     Cond = fun() -> case os:type() of
  690: 			{win32, nt} ->
  691: 			    skip;
  692: 			_ ->
  693: 			    run
  694: 		    end
  695: 	   end,
  696:     maybe_run(Cond, F).
  697: 
  698: maybe_run(Cond, F) ->
  699:     case Cond() of
  700: 	run ->
  701: 	    F();
  702: 	skip ->
  703: 	    ok
  704:     end.
  705: 
  706: 	    
  707: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  708: 
  709: %% Get name and address info.
  710: api_b_name_and_addr_info(suite) ->
  711:     [];
  712: api_b_name_and_addr_info(doc) ->
  713:     [];
  714: api_b_name_and_addr_info(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  715:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
  716:     tc_try(api_b_name_and_addr_info,
  717:            fun() ->
  718:                    ok = api_b_name_and_addr_info()
  719:            end).
  720: 
  721: 
  722: api_b_name_and_addr_info() ->
  723:     Domain = inet,
  724:     Addr   = which_local_addr(Domain),
  725:     SA     = #{family => Domain, addr => Addr},
  726:     try
  727:         begin
  728:             i("try getnameinfo for"
  729:               "~n   ~p", [SA]),
  730:             Hostname =
  731:                 case net:getnameinfo(SA) of
  732:                     {ok, #{host := Name, service := Service} = NameInfo} 
  733:                       when is_list(Name) andalso is_list(Service) ->
  734:                         i("getnameinfo: "
  735:                           "~n   ~p", [NameInfo]),
  736:                         Name;
  737:                     {ok, BadNameInfo} ->
  738:                         ?FAIL({getnameinfo, SA, BadNameInfo});
  739:                     {error, enotsup = ReasonNI} ->
  740:                         i("getnameinfo not supported - skipping"),
  741:                         ?SKIP({getnameinfo, ReasonNI});
  742:                     {error, Reason1} ->
  743:                         ?FAIL({getnameinfo, SA, Reason1})
  744:                 end,
  745:             i("try getaddrinfo for"
  746:               "~n   ~p", [Hostname]),
  747:             case net:getaddrinfo(Hostname) of
  748:                 {ok, AddrInfos} when is_list(AddrInfos) ->
  749:                     i("getaddrinfo: "
  750:                       "~n   ~p", [AddrInfos]),
  751:                     verify_addr_info(AddrInfos, Domain);
  752:                 {ok, BadAddrInfo} ->
  753:                     ?FAIL({getaddrinfo, Hostname, BadAddrInfo});
  754:                 {error, enotsup = ReasonAI} ->
  755:                     i("getaddrinfo not supported - skipping"),
  756:                     ?SKIP({getaddrinfo, ReasonAI});
  757:                 {error, Reason2} ->
  758:                     ?FAIL({getaddrinfo, Hostname, Reason2})
  759:             end
  760:         end
  761:     catch
  762:         error : notsup = Reason ->
  763:             i("~w => skipping", [Reason]),
  764:             skip(Reason)
  765:     end.
  766: 
  767: 
  768: verify_addr_info(AddrInfos, Domain) when (AddrInfos =/= []) ->
  769:     verify_addr_info2(AddrInfos, Domain).
  770:     
  771: verify_addr_info2([], _Domain) ->
  772:     ok;
  773: verify_addr_info2([#{addr     := #{addr   := Addr,
  774: 				   family := Domain,
  775: 				   port   := Port},
  776:                      family   := Domain,
  777:                      socktype := _Type,
  778:                      protocol := _Proto}|T], Domain) 
  779:   when is_integer(Port) andalso
  780:        (((Domain =:= inet) andalso is_tuple(Addr) andalso (size(Addr) =:= 4)) orelse
  781:         ((Domain =:= inet6) andalso is_tuple(Addr) andalso (size(Addr) =:= 8))) -> 
  782:     verify_addr_info2(T, Domain);
  783: verify_addr_info2([#{family := DomainA}|T], DomainB) 
  784:   when (DomainA =/= DomainB) ->
  785:     %% Ignore entries for other domains
  786:     verify_addr_info2(T, DomainB);
  787: verify_addr_info2([BadAddrInfo|_], Domain) ->
  788:     ?FAIL({bad_address_info, BadAddrInfo, Domain}).
  789: 
  790: 
  791: 
  792: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  793: 
  794: %% Verify (interface) name and index functions.
  795: %% if_names/0,
  796: %% if_name2index/1
  797: %% if_index2name/1
  798: api_b_name_and_index(suite) ->
  799:     [];
  800: api_b_name_and_index(doc) ->
  801:     [];
  802: api_b_name_and_index(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  803:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
  804:     tc_try(api_b_name_and_index,
  805:            fun() ->
  806:                    ok = api_b_name_and_index()
  807:            end).
  808: 
  809: 
  810: api_b_name_and_index() ->
  811:     try
  812:         begin
  813:             Names =
  814:                 case net:if_names() of
  815:                     {ok, N} when is_list(N) andalso (N =/= []) ->
  816:                         N;
  817:                     {error, enotsup = Reason} ->
  818:                         i("if_names not supported - skipping"),
  819:                         ?SKIP({if_names, Reason});
  820:                     {error, Reason} ->
  821:                         ?FAIL({if_names, Reason})
  822:                 end,
  823:             verify_if_names(Names)
  824:         end
  825:     catch
  826:         error : notsup = CReason ->
  827:             i("~w => skipping", [CReason]),
  828:             skip(CReason)
  829:     end.
  830:         
  831: 
  832: verify_if_names([]) ->
  833:     ok;
  834: verify_if_names([{Index, Name}|T]) ->
  835:     case net:if_name2index(Name) of
  836:         {ok, Index} ->
  837:             ok;
  838:         {ok, BadIndex} ->
  839:             ?FAIL({if_name2index, Name, Index, BadIndex});
  840:         {error, enotsup = Reason_N2I1} ->
  841:             i("if_name2index not supported - skipping"),
  842:             ?SKIP({if_name2index, Reason_N2I1});
  843:         {error, Reason_N2I2} ->
  844:             ?FAIL({if_name2index, Name, Reason_N2I2})
  845:     end,
  846:     case net:if_index2name(Index) of
  847:         {ok, Name} ->
  848:             ok;
  849:         {ok, BadName} ->
  850:             ?FAIL({if_index2name, Index, Name, BadName});
  851:         {error, enotsup = Reason_I2N1} ->
  852:             i("if_index2name not supported - skipping"),
  853:             ?SKIP({if_index2name, Reason_I2N1});
  854:         {error, Reason_I2N2} ->
  855:             ?FAIL({if_index2name, Index, Reason_I2N2})
  856:     end,
  857:     verify_if_names(T).
  858: 
  859: 
  860: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  861: 
  862: api_m_getaddrinfo_v4() ->
  863:     required(v4).
  864: 
  865: api_m_getaddrinfo_v4(suite) ->
  866:     [];
  867: api_m_getaddrinfo_v4(doc) ->
  868:     [];
  869: api_m_getaddrinfo_v4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  870:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
  871:     Pre  = fun() ->
  872:                    {Name, FullName, IPStr, IP, Aliases,_,_} =
  873:                        ct:get_config(test_host_ipv4_only),
  874:                    #{name      => Name,
  875:                      full_name => FullName,
  876:                      ip_string => IPStr,
  877:                      ip        => IP,
  878:                      aliases   => Aliases,
  879:                      family    => inet}
  880:            end,
  881:     Case = fun(Info) ->
  882:                    ok = api_m_getaddrinfo(Info)
  883:            end,
  884:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  885:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  886:            Pre, Case, Post).
  887: 
  888: 
  889: 
  890: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  891: 
  892: api_m_getaddrinfo_v6() ->
  893:     required(v6).
  894: 
  895: api_m_getaddrinfo_v6(suite) ->
  896:     [];
  897: api_m_getaddrinfo_v6(doc) ->
  898:     [];
  899: api_m_getaddrinfo_v6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  900:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
  901:     Pre  = fun() ->
  902:                    {Name, FullName, IPStr, IP, Aliases} =
  903:                        ct:get_config(test_host_ipv6_only),
  904:                    #{name      => Name,
  905:                      full_name => FullName,
  906:                      ip_string => IPStr,
  907:                      ip        => IP,
  908:                      aliases   => Aliases,
  909:                      family    => inet6}
  910:            end,
  911:     Case = fun(Info) ->
  912:                    ok = api_m_getaddrinfo(Info)
  913:            end,
  914:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  915:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  916:            Pre, Case, Post).
  917: 
  918: 
  919: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  920: 
  921: api_m_getaddrinfo(#{name   := Name,
  922:                     family := Domain,
  923:                     ip     := IP}) ->
  924:     i("Check address info for ~p with"
  925:       "~n   Domain: ~p"
  926:       "~n   IP:     ~p", [Name, Domain, IP]),
  927:     try net:getaddrinfo(Name) of
  928:         {ok, AddrInfos} ->
  929:             %% Check that we can actually find this IP in the list
  930:             api_m_getaddrinfo_verify(AddrInfos, Name, Domain, IP);
  931:         {error, enotsup = ReasonAI} ->
  932:             i("getaddrinfo not supported - skipping"),
  933:             ?SKIP({getaddrinfo, ReasonAI});
  934:         {error, Reason} ->
  935:             ?FAIL({gethaddrinfo, Name, Reason})
  936:     catch
  937:         error : notsup = Reason ->
  938:             i("~w => skipping", [Reason]),
  939:             skip(Reason)
  940:     end.
  941: 
  942: 
  943: 
  944: %% First we filter out the address info of the correct domain (family), then:
  945: %% 1) If there is no address info left: SKIP
  946: %% 2) If there are address info, check for the selected address
  947: 
  948: api_m_getaddrinfo_verify(AddrInfos, Name, Domain, IP) ->
  949:     i("Attempt to verify from ~w address-infos", [length(AddrInfos)]),
  950:     AddrInfos2 = [AI || #{family := D} = AI <- AddrInfos, D =:= Domain],
  951:     case AddrInfos2 of
  952:         [] ->
  953:             i("No address info of correct domain (~w) available", [Domain]),
  954:             ?SKIP({no_ai_of_domain, Domain});
  955:         _ ->
  956:             api_m_getaddrinfo_verify2(AddrInfos, Name, Domain, IP)
  957:     end.
  958: 
  959: api_m_getaddrinfo_verify2([], Name, Domain, IP) ->
  960:     i("No match found for ~p: "
  961:       "~n   Domain:   ~p"
  962:       "~n   IP:       ~p", [Name, Domain, IP]),
  963:     ?FAIL({not_found, Name, Domain, IP});
  964: api_m_getaddrinfo_verify2([#{family := Domain,
  965:                             addr   := #{addr   := IP, 
  966:                                         family := Domain} = _SockAddr} = 
  967:                               AddrInfo|_],
  968:                          Name, Domain, IP) ->
  969:     i("Found match for ~p: "
  970:       "~n   AddrInfo: ~p"
  971:       "~n   Domain:   ~p"
  972:       "~n   IP:       ~p", [Name, AddrInfo, Domain, IP]),
  973:     ok;
  974: api_m_getaddrinfo_verify2([AddrInfo|AddrInfos], Name, Domain, IP) ->
  975:     i("No match: "
  976:       "~n   AddrInfo: ~p"
  977:       "~n   Domain: ~p"
  978:       "~n   IP:     ~p", [AddrInfo, Domain, IP]),
  979:     api_m_getaddrinfo_verify2(AddrInfos, Name, Domain, IP).
  980: 
  981: 
  982: 
  983: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  984: 
  985: api_m_getnameinfo_v4() ->
  986:     required(v4).
  987:

  989:     [];
  990: api_m_getnameinfo_v4(doc) ->
  991:     [];
  992: api_m_getnameinfo_v4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  993:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
  994:     Pre  = fun() ->
  995:                    {Name, FullName, IPStr, IP, Aliases,_,_} =
  996:                        ct:get_config(test_host_ipv4_only),
  997:                    #{name      => Name,
  998:                      full_name => FullName,
  999:                      ip_string => IPStr,
 1000:                      ip        => IP,
 1001:                      aliases   => Aliases,
 1002:                      family    => inet}
 1003:            end,
 1004:     Case = fun(Info) ->
 1005:                    ok = api_m_getnameinfo(Info)
 1006:            end,
 1007:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1008:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1009:            Pre, Case, Post).
 1010:

 1015: api_m_getnameinfo_v6() ->
 1016:     required(v6).
 1017:

 1019:     [];
 1020: api_m_getnameinfo_v6(doc) ->
 1021:     [];
 1022: api_m_getnameinfo_v6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1023:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
 1024:     Pre  = fun() ->
 1025:                    {Name, FullName, IPStr, IP, Aliases} =
 1026:                        ct:get_config(test_host_ipv6_only),
 1027:                    #{name      => Name,
 1028:                      full_name => FullName,
 1029:                      ip_string => IPStr,
 1030:                      ip        => IP,
 1031:                      aliases   => Aliases,
 1032:                      family    => inet6}
 1033:            end,
 1034:     Case = fun(Info) ->
 1035:                    ok = api_m_getnameinfo(Info)
 1036:            end,

 1038:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1039:            Pre, Case, Post).

 1041: 
 1042: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1043: 
 1044: api_m_getnameinfo(#{name      := Name,
 1045:                     full_name := FName,
 1046:                     family    := Domain,
 1047:                     ip        := IP}) ->
 1048:     i("Check name info for ~p with"
 1049:       "~n   Domain: ~p"
 1050:       "~n   IP:     ~p", [Name, Domain, IP]),
 1051:     SA = #{family => Domain,
 1052:            addr   => IP},
 1053:     try net:getnameinfo(SA) of
 1054:         {ok, NameInfo} ->
 1055:             %% Check that we can actually find this IP in the list
 1056:             api_m_getnameinfo_verify(NameInfo, Name, FName, IP);
 1057:         {error, enotsup = ReasonAI} ->
 1058:             i("getaddrinfo not supported - skipping"),
 1059:             ?SKIP({getnameinfo, ReasonAI});
 1060:         {error, Reason} ->
 1061:             ?FAIL({getnameinfo, Name, Reason})
 1062:     catch
 1063:         error : notsup = Reason ->
 1064:             i("~w => skipping", [Reason]),
 1065:             skip(Reason)
 1066:     end.
 1067: 
 1068: 
 1069: api_m_getnameinfo_verify(#{host := Name} = NameInfo, Name, _FName, _IP) ->
 1070:     i("Found (name) match for ~p: "
 1071:       "~n   NameInfo: ~p", [Name, NameInfo]),
 1072:     ok;
 1073: api_m_getnameinfo_verify(#{host := FName} = NameInfo, _Name, FName, _IP) ->
 1074:     i("Found (full name) match for ~p: "
 1075:       "~n   NameInfo: ~p", [FName, NameInfo]),
 1076:     ok;
 1077: api_m_getnameinfo_verify(#{host := IPStr} = NameInfo, Name, FName, IP)
 1078:   when (size(IP) =:= 8) ->
 1079:     %% On some hosts we get back the IPv6 address as a string.
 1080:     %% Exampole: 
 1081:     %%     {65216,0,0,0,2560,8447,65202,46249} -> "fec0::a00:20ff:feb2:b4a9"
 1082:     %% This is possibly because of bad config of the host.
 1083:     case inet_parse:ipv6_address(IPStr) of
 1084:         {ok, IP} ->
 1085:             i("Found (IP string) \"match\" for ~p: "
 1086:               "~n   NameInfo: ~p", [IP, NameInfo]),
 1087:             ok;
 1088:         _ ->
 1089:             ?FAIL({not_found, NameInfo, Name, FName})
 1090:     end;
 1091: api_m_getnameinfo_verify(NameInfo, Name, FName, _IP) ->
 1092:     i("No match found for ~p (~p): "
 1093:       "~n   NameInfo: ~p", [Name, FName, NameInfo]),
 1094:     ?FAIL({not_found, NameInfo, Name, FName}).
 1095: 
 1096: 
 1097: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1098: 
 1099: api_m_getservbyname_overflow(suite) ->
 1100:     [];
 1101: api_m_getservbyname_overflow(doc) ->
 1102:     [];
 1103: api_m_getservbyname_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1104:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
 1105:     Pre  = fun() ->
 1106:                    #{}
 1107:            end,
 1108:     Case = fun(_Info) ->
 1109:                    ?P("try name as large atom"),
 1110:                    {error, einval} =
 1111:                        net:getservbyname(
 1112:                          list_to_atom(lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(128, "x"))),
 1113:                          tcp),
 1114:                    ?P("try name as too large string"),
 1115:                    {error, einval} =
 1116:                        net:getservbyname(
 1117:                          lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(257, "x")),
 1118:                          tcp),
 1119:                    ok
 1120:            end,
 1121:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1122:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1123:            Pre, Case, Post).
 1124: 
 1125: 
 1126: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1127: 
 1128: %% This gets the local address (not 127.0...)
 1129: %% We should really implement this using the (new) net module,
 1130: %% but until that gets the necessary functionality...
 1131: which_local_addr(Domain) ->
 1132:     case ?LIB:which_local_addr(Domain) of
 1133:         {ok, Addr} ->
 1134:             Addr;
 1135:         {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1136:             skip(ERROR)
 1137:     end.
 1138: 
 1139: 
 1140: 
 1141: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1142: 
 1143: wrong_port(Service, Proto, WrongPort, RightPort) ->
 1144:     ?FAIL({Service, Proto, {wrong_port, WrongPort, RightPort}}).
 1145: 
 1146: wrong_service(Port, Proto, WrongService, RightService) ->
 1147:     ?FAIL({Port, Proto, {wrong_service, WrongService, RightService}}).
 1148: 
 1149: %% not_yet_implemented() ->
 1150: %%     skip("not yet implemented").
 1151: 
 1152: skip(Reason) ->
 1153:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 1154: 
 1155: 
 1156: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1157: 
 1158: formatted_timestamp() ->
 1159:     format_timestamp(os:timestamp()).
 1160: 
 1161: format_timestamp({_N1, _N2, _N3} = TS) ->
 1162:     {_Date, Time}   = calendar:now_to_local_time(TS),
 1163:     %% {YYYY,MM,DD}   = Date,
 1164:     {Hour,Min,Sec} = Time,
 1165:     %% FormatTS = 
 1166:     %%     io_lib:format("~.4w-~.2.0w-~.2.0w ~.2.0w:~.2.0w:~.2.0w.~w",
 1167:     %%                   [YYYY, MM, DD, Hour, Min, Sec, N3]),  
 1168:     FormatTS = io_lib:format("~.2.0w:~.2.0w:~.2.0w", [Hour, Min, Sec]),  
 1169:     lists:flatten(FormatTS).
 1170: 
 1171:    
 1172: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1173: 
 1174: tc_try(Case, TC) ->
 1175:     ?TC_TRY(Case, TC).
 1176: 
 1177: tc_try(Case, Pre, TC, Post) ->
 1178:     ?TC_TRY(Case, Pre, TC, Post).
 1179: 
 1180: 
 1181: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1182: 
 1183: %% Required configuration
 1184: required(v4) ->
 1185:     [{require, test_host_ipv4_only}];
 1186: required(v6) ->
 1187:     [{require, test_host_ipv6_only}].
 1188: 
 1189: 
 1190: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1191: 
 1192: %% l2a(S) when is_list(S) ->
 1193: %%     list_to_atom(S).
 1194: 
 1195: %% l2b(L) when is_list(L) ->
 1196: %%     list_to_binary(L).
 1197: 
 1198: %% b2l(B) when is_binary(B) ->
 1199: %%     binary_to_list(B).
 1200: 
 1201: f(F, A) ->
 1202:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format(F, A)).
 1203: 
 1204: 
 1205: i(F) ->
 1206:     i(F, []).
 1207: 
 1208: i(F, A) ->
 1209:     FStr = f("[~s] " ++ F, [formatted_timestamp()|A]),
 1210:     io:format(user, FStr ++ "~n", []),
 1211:     io:format(FStr, []).
